newsitem.title: USA: High demand, maintenance draw US distillate stocks.
newsitem.headline: High demand, maintenance draw US distillate stocks.

text.p: Strong demand and refinery maintenance led to a 4.8 million barrels drawdown in U.S. distillate inventories last week, the Energy Information Administration said Wednesday.
EIA said 3.3 million barrels out of the 4.8 million barrels drawdown came in diesel stocks.

U.S. demand for distillates, including heating oil and diesel, stood at 3.7 million barrels per day for the week ended January 7, while distillate production held at 3.1 million bpd amid continued refinery maintenance, EIA said in its weekly distillate watch.
As a result, distillate stocks fell to 109.4 million barrels from 114.2 million barrels in the previous week.
Inventories were down 300,000 barrels from a year ago and stood about 5.0 million barrels below normal.
